abstract: Data crunching is usually about mouse clicks and sensors. One company creates products from the wealth of free government information.
snippet: Data crunching is usually about mouse clicks and sensors. One company creates products from the wealth of free government information.
lead_paragraph: Big data, the term for scanning loads of information for possibly profitable patterns, is a growing sector of corporate technology. Mostly people think in terms of online behavior, like mouse clicks, LinkedIn affiliations and Amazon shopping choices. But other big databases in the real world, lying around for years, are there to exploit.

headline.main: Big Data in the Dirt (and the Cloud)
